threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered hacktool. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects the presence of a number of Windows API functionality often seen within embedded executables. When this signature alerts on an executable, it is not an indication of malicious behavior. However, if seen firing in other file types, deeper investigation may be warranted.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Generic Detection for multiple RAT families, PUPs, Packers and suspicious executables
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Lucas Acha (http://www.lukeacha.com)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Registry Persistence via Service in Safe Mode
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the modification of the registry to allow a driver or service to persist in Safe Mode.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=Tamper-Safemode; EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\syswow64\MsiExec.exe; Details=Service; TargetObject=HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\SafeBoot\Network\SplashtopRemoteService\(Default)}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious DotNET CLR Usage Log Artifact
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of Usage Log files by the CLR (clr.dll). These files are named after the executing process once the assembly is finished executing for the first time in the (user) session context.

match_context.values: @{RuleName=ProcessHostingdotNETCode; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\rundll32.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Microsoft\CLR_v4.0_32\UsageLogs\rundll32.exe.log; EventID=11}

@{RuleName=ProcessHostingdotNETCode; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\rundll32.exe; EventID=11; TargetFilename=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\config\systemprofile\AppData\Local\Microsoft\CLR_v4.0_32\UsageLogs\rundll32.exe.log}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1060,RunKey; EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\Temp\{4B6E3676-4A88-4804-949E-A446213325C5}\.be\dotnet-runtime-6.0.26-win-x64.exe; Details="C:\ProgramData\Package Cache\{d03cab7b-6d8b-4d83-a714-cba2c8922e2a}\dotnet-runtime-6.0.26-win-x64.exe" /burn.runonce; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce\{d03cab7b-6d8b-4d83-a714-cba2c8922e2a}}

@{RuleName=T1060,RunKey; EventType=SetValue; Details="C:\ProgramData\Package Cache\{d03cab7b-6d8b-4d83-a714-cba2c8922e2a}\dotnet-runtime-6.0.26-win-x64.exe" /burn.runonce; Image=C:\ProgramData\Package Cache\{d03cab7b-6d8b-4d83-a714-cba2c8922e2a}\dotnet-runtime-6.0.26-win-x64.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunOnce\{d03cab7b-6d8b-4d83-a714-cba2c8922e2a}}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

match_context.values: @{Product=Windows Installer - Unicode; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\TEMP\; OriginalFileName=msiexec.exe; Hashes=MD5=D3C21CD0C70DC36FDD8A61E4517A226D,SHA256=D7A94CE4C50764B8A6F67DB308F8609AC38F08D1113079EAF81A25AB44E72BA6,IMPHASH=13C7ACE23F99CD5FBC3ABD5C16BF2DCE; Description=Windows\xae installer; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Program Files (x86)\ATERA Networks\AteraAgent\Packages\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent.exe" 8ff71162-8c49-4372-b3bc-baf040300733 "75b04273-5047-446b-839b-7422e5e770b4" agent-api.atera.com/Production 443 or8ixLi90Mf "checkforupdates"; CommandLine="msiexec.exe" /i C:\Windows\TEMP\ateraAgentSetup64_1_8_6_7.msi /lv* AteraSetupLog.txt /qn /norestart; FileVersion=5.0.17134.228 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Program Files (x86)\ATERA Networks\AteraAgent\Packages\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent\AgentPackageUpgradeAgent.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remote Access Tool Services Have Been Installed - Security
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects service installation of different remote access tools software. These software are often abused by threat actors to perform

match_context.values: @{SubjectDomainName=WORKGROUP; ClientProcessId=2948; ServiceType=0x10; SubjectLogonId=999; EventID=4697; ServiceName=AteraAgent; SubjectUserName=DESKTOP-ET51AJO$; SubjectUserSid=S-1-5-18}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Suspicious Registry File Imported Via Reg.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=CEE2A7E57DF2A159A065A34913A055C2,SHA256=829206FB125010140C40F9A8D08ECEBCBD437A50B351D420B473C13F931191CC,IMPHASH=869B9FF91668F96EF68FBE0DB3602587; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\; OriginalFileName=reg.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Registry Console Tool; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\syswow64\MsiExec.exe -Embedding E17CEC97F0CB1E27B1E9B8DE55236FBB E Global\MSI0000; CommandLine=reg.exe  import "C:\Windows\TEMP\{D874ECCB-6342-4EC5-9DB9-77CFFCC3C2A3}\CredProvider_Inst.reg" /reg:64; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\msiexec.exe; IntegrityLevel=System; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Persistence Via COM Search Order Hijacking
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects potential COM object hijacking leveraging the COM Search Order

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1122; EventType=SetValue; Details=SRCredentialProvider.dll; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKCR\CLSID\{97E1814E-5601-41c8-9971-10C319EF61CC}\InprocServer32\(Default)}

@{RuleName=T1122; EventType=SetValue; EventID=13; Image=C:\Program Files (x86)\Splashtop\Splashtop Remote\Server\SRService.exe; Details=C:\Windows\system32\SRCredentialProvider.dll; TargetObject=HKCR\CLSID\{97E1814E-5601-41c8-9971-10C319EF61CC}\InprocServer32\(Default)}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a new office macro files on the systems

match_context.values: @{TargetFilename=C:\Users\Administrator\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Templates\~$Normal.dotm}
